sen.j: 印籍（いんせき）とは、篆刻に関する書籍全般を差す。
sen.e: Inseki refers to all the books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal).
Inseki refers to books in general on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal).
Inseki refers to books in general on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal).
It is also called insho or inbon.
It is also called insho or inbon.
It is also called insho or inbon.

sen.j: 印籍は印譜、印論、印人伝に分類できる。
sen.e: Inseki can be classified into three categories: inpu (compilation of seal marks), inron (theory of seals), and story of engravers of tenkoku.
Inseki can be classified into three categories: inpu (compilation of seal marks), inron (theory of seals), and story of engravers of tenkoku.
Inseki can be classified into three categories: inpu (compilation of seal marks), inron (theory of seals), and story of engravers of tenkoku.

sen.j: 印譜は印影を中心にその研究あるいは美術的鑑賞を目的とする。
sen.e: The purpose of inpu is the study or artistic appreciation of inei (impression of a seal) and so on.
The purpose of inpu is the study or artistic appreciation of inei (impression of a seal) and so on.
The purpose of inpu is the study or artistic appreciation of inei (impression of a seal) and so on.

sen.j: 印論は更に印章論、篆刻論、印籍論に分けられる。
sen.e: Inron can be further classified into theory of insho (seals), theory of tenkoku and theory of inseki.
Inron can be further classified into theory of insho (seals), theory of tenkoku and theory of inseki.
Inron can be further classified into theory of insho (seals), theory of tenkoku and theory of inseki.

sen.j: 日本においては曽之唯『印籍考』がユニークな印論として特筆できる。
sen.e: In Japan, a striking example is "A study of inseki", a unique inron, written by Soshii.
In Japan, a striking example is "A study of inseki", a unique inron, written by Soshii.
In Japan, a striking example is "A study of inseki", a unique inron, written by Soshii.

sen.j: 曽之唯は別に印文、印語を集めた『印語纂』を著している。
sen.e: Soshii wrote other books including "Compilation of Ingo (words engraved on the seal)" in which inmon (words or symbols engraved on the seal) and ingo are collected together.
Soshii wrote other books including "Compilation of Ingo (words engraved on the seal)" in which inmon (words or symbols engraved on the seal) and ingo are collected together.
Soshii wrote other books including "Compilation of Ingo (words engraved on the seal)" in which inmon (words or symbols engraved on the seal) and ingo are collected together.

sen.j: 代表的な印人伝としては、中国では周亮工『印人伝』・汪啓淑『続印人伝』、日本では中井敬所の遺稿『日本印人伝』や伏見冲敬編『印人伝集成』などが挙げられる。
sen.e: As for story of engravers of tenkoku, major examples in China include "The Story of Engravers of Tenkoku" written by Ryoko SHU and "A Story of Engravers of Tenkoku, Continued" written by Keishuku OH, and major examples in Japan include "A Story of Japanese Engravers of Tenkoku", literary remains left by Keisho Nakai, and "A Story of Engravers of Tenkoku, Corpus" compiled by Chukei FUSHIMI.

As for story of engravers of tenkoku, major examples in China include "The Story of Engravers of Tenkoku" written by Ryoko SHU and "A Story of Engravers of Tenkoku, Continued" written by Keishuku OH, and major examples in Japan include "A Story of Japanese Engravers of Tenkoku", literary remains left by Keisho Nakai, and "A Story of Engravers of Tenkoku, Corpus" compiled by Chukei FUSHIMI.

As for story of engravers of tenkoku, major examples in China include "The Story of Engravers of Tenkoku" written by Ryoko SHU and "A Story of Engravers of Tenkoku, Continued" written by Keishuku OH, and major examples in Japan include "A Story of Japanese Engravers of Tenkoku", literary remains left by Keisho Nakai, and "A Story of Engravers of Tenkoku, Corpus" compiled by Chukei FUSHIMI.
